What area. Well right now I live in Staten

So I'm very proud.

was not something that was typical and
I joined the Staten Island development disabilities council and they were a big help
and still member.
I think they're great. So tell me about the day Alex was diagnosed.

family had. A child you know with
disabilities or like wondering well you know. Why you know
and you know you go through all the different steps and I don't think you

say your son has autism.
I don't know that your son has autism. I'm so sorry and I was just like

Yeah it's sort of it sucks that he has. A disability you know and it's

But.

How would you describe the emotions of diagnosis.

are so many difficult days which are so frustrating and

. I don't actually even remember it. I mean
. It's just it's not even a

You know that that's really really really tough but
. You know you just love them. You just after
really just love and you have to go on and you have to give yourself

. You know give them the best quality of life. And the biggest

No.
